intro: Diplospora malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca diplospore, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
